summary: This document is the Third Amendment to the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust, executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein. It specifies the distribution of $5,000,000 to Darren K. Indyke, contingent on his being alive at the time of distribution. The amendment reflects Epstein's authority as the Grantor to make changes to the trust.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the Grantor of the trust and has executed the amendment to the trust.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Darren K. Indyke is named as a beneficiary in the trust amendment, set to receive $5,000,000.

persons.name: Harry I. Beller
persons.context: Harry I. Beller is the Notary Public who acknowledged the execution of the trust amendment by Jeffrey E. Epstein.

connections.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein, as the Grantor of the trust, has designated Darren K. Indyke as a beneficiary entitled to receive funds from the trust.

events.title: Third Amendment to the Trust
events.description: The Third Amendment to the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust was executed, adding a provision for the distribution of $5,000,000 to Darren K. Indyke.

keyFacts: The document is a legal amendment to the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust.
Darren K. Indyke is set to receive $5,000,000 from the trust if he is alive at the time of distribution.
The amendment was executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein on January 4, 2004.
Harry I. Beller served as the Notary Public for the execution of this document.
